text: Cantharellus friesii, the orange or velvet chanterelle, is a fungus native to Asia and Europe. The cap color varies from deep yellow to reddish orange and is 2–4 cm wide. It occurs in beech, fir and spruce forests. C. friesii is considered a good edible mushroom, but because of its rarity, it deserves protection. The specific epithet friesii honors the mycologist Elias Magnus Fries. ==References== * ==External links== * friesii Category:Fungi described in 1869 Category:Fungi of Asia Category:Edible fungi Category:Fungi of Europe
title: Cantharellus friesii
